title: 2015 (No. 49 of 2015)) and 128 (2) of the Garda Síochána Act 2005 (No. 20 of
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as 

the Garda Síochána 

(Associations) (Amendment) Regulations 2021. 

(2) The Garda Síochána (Associations) Regulations 1978 to 2020 and these 
Regulations may be cited together as the Garda Síochána (Associations) 
Regulations 1978 to 2021. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited garda siochana (associations) (amendment) regulation 2021 (2) garda siochana (associations) regulation 1978 2020 regulation may cited together garda siochana (associations) regulation 1978 2021 interpretation

title: 2015 (No. 49 of 2015)) and 128 (2) of the Garda Síochána Act 2005 (No. 20 of
heading: 3. (1) A relevant meeting or a relevant conference need not be held at a
text_raw:
3. (1) A relevant meeting or a relevant conference need not be held at a 
physical venue but may be conducted wholly or partly by the use of electronic 
communications technology so long as all attendees have a reasonable 
opportunity to participate in the meeting or conference in accordance with this 
Regulation. 

(2) 

(a) Provision may be made in standing orders or otherwise for 
participation in a relevant meeting or relevant conference by the 
use of electronic communications technology, including for a 
mechanism for casting votes by an attendee, whether before or 
during the meeting or conference, 

(b) The mechanism referred to in paragraph (a) shall not require the 
attendee to be physically present at the relevant meeting or 
relevant conference or require the attendee to appoint a proxy 
who is to be physically present at the meeting or conference. 

(3) Any temporary failure or disruption of electronic communications 
technology shall not invalidate a relevant meeting or relevant conference 
merely by virtue of that temporary failure or disruption. 

(4) In this Regulation – 

“attendee” means – 

(a) 

(b) 

in relation to a relevant meeting, a member of the branch or any 
other person attending the meeting, and 

in relation to a relevant conference, a delegate to the conference 
or any other person attending the conference; 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [275] 

“electronic communications technology”, in relation to a relevant meeting or 
relevant conference, means technology that enables real-time transmission and 
real-time two-way audio or audio-visual communication enabling attendees to 
participate in the meeting or conference using such technology from a remote 
location; 

“relevant conference” means any of the following conferences of the 
Association in the year 2021: 

(a) 

the Annual Delegate Conference; 

(b) 

a Special Delegate Conference; 

“relevant meeting” means any of the following meetings of the members of a 
branch of the Association in the year 2021: 

(a) 

the Annual General Meeting; 

(b) 

a special general meeting. 

Annual General Meetings for the year 2021

title: 2015 (No. 49 of 2015)) and 128 (2) of the Garda Síochána Act 2005 (No. 20 of
heading: 4. Notwithstanding Article 3(5) of the Second Schedule to the Regulations
text_raw:
4. Notwithstanding Article 3(5) of the Second Schedule to the Regulations 
of 1978, the Annual General Meeting of the members of each branch of the 
Association in the year 2021 shall be held – 

(a) 

as soon as practicable after the making of these Regulations, and 

(b) 

in advance of the 2021 Annual Delegate Conference. 

Annual Delegate Conferences for the year 2020
text_norm: 4 notwithstanding article 3(5) second schedule regulation 1978 annual general meeting member branch association year 2021 shall held - (a) soon practicable making regulation (b) advance 2021 annual delegate conference annual delegate conference year 2020

title: 2015 (No. 49 of 2015)) and 128 (2) of the Garda Síochána Act 2005 (No. 20 of
heading: 5. Notwithstanding Article 4(5) of the Second Schedule to the Regulations
text_raw:
5. Notwithstanding Article 4(5) of the Second Schedule to the Regulations 
of 1978, the requirement in that Article shall be deemed not to apply in respect 
of the Annual Delegate Conference in the year 2020. 

Annual Delegate Conference for the year 2021
text_norm: 5 notwithstanding article 4(5) second schedule regulation 1978 requirement article shall deemed apply respect annual delegate conference year 2020 annual delegate conference year 2021

title: 2015 (No. 49 of 2015)) and 128 (2) of the Garda Síochána Act 2005 (No. 20 of
heading: 6. Notwithstanding Article 4(5) of the Second Schedule to the Regulations
text_raw:
6. Notwithstanding Article 4(5) of the Second Schedule to the Regulations 
of 1978, the Annual Delegate Conference in the year 2021 (in these 
Regulations referred to as the “2021 Annual Delegate Conference”) may be 
held as soon as is practicable in the year 2021 after the making of these 
Regulations. 

Standing Orders Committee
text_norm: 6 notwithstanding article 4(5) second schedule regulation 1978 annual delegate conference year 2021 (in regulation referred 2021 annual delegate conference ) may held soon practicable year 2021 making regulation standing order committee

title: 2015 (No. 49 of 2015)) and 128 (2) of the Garda Síochána Act 2005 (No. 20 of
heading: 7. Notwithstanding Article 4(7) of the Second Schedule to the Regulations
text_raw:
7. Notwithstanding Article 4(7) of the Second Schedule to the Regulations 

of 1978 – 

(a) 

the term of office of the Standing Orders Committee elected by 
the Annual Delegate Conference held in the year 2019 shall be 
deemed to have commenced on the date of the election 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [275] 5 

concerned and to expire at the close of the 2021 Annual 
Delegate Conference, and 

(b) 

the Standing Orders Committee referred to in paragraph (a) may 
perform the functions of a Standing Orders Committee in 
respect of the 2021 Annual Delegate Conference and any 
Special Delegate Conference held before that Conference. 

Trustees
text_norm: 7 notwithstanding article 4(7) second schedule regulation 1978 - (a) term office standing order committee elected annual delegate conference held year 2019 shall deemed commenced date election 275 5 concerned expire close 2021 annual delegate conference (b) standing order committee referred paragraph (a) may perform function standing order committee respect 2021 annual delegate conference special delegate conference held conference trustee

title: 2015 (No. 49 of 2015)) and 128 (2) of the Garda Síochána Act 2005 (No. 20 of
heading: 8. Notwithstanding Article 8 of the Second Schedule to the Regulations of
text_raw:
8. Notwithstanding Article 8 of the Second Schedule to the Regulations of 

1978 – 

(a) 

(b) 

the term of office of the Trustee who was elected by the Annual 
Delegate Conference held in 2017 shall be deemed to have 
commenced on the date of the election concerned and to expire 
at the close of the 2021 Annual Delegate Conference, and 

the Trustee elected by the 2021 Annual Delegate Conference in 
accordance with Article 8 of the Second Schedule to the 
Regulations of 1978 shall hold office until the close of the 
Annual Delegate Conference held in 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [275] 

The Government hereby approve of the foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 

11 May, 2021. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Justice, 

11 May, 2021. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Justice.
